snippet: The exit of the war economy in Afghanistan will leave a hole for the Pepsi bottle boys, who help guide traffic with bright plastic bottles along a NATO supply route.
abstract: War economy touches everybody in Afghanistan and will leave a desperate hole when it is gone, not least for young Afghans known as the Pepsi bottle boys, prime example of how Afghans have fit their lives around America's military presence;  boys earn meager living by helping to guide traffic flowing on one of the main NATO supply routes to Kabul, and one of Afghanistan’s deadliest stretches of road.
lead_paragraph: The exit of the war economy in Afghanistan will leave a hole for the Pepsi bottle boys, who help guide traffic with bright plastic bottles along a NATO supply route.
